properties.headline: Winter Storm Watch issued January 13 at 1:19PM PST until January 17 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Reno NV
properties.description:
* CHANGES...No major changes.

* WHAT...Heavy snow possible. Total snow accumulations of 5 to 10
inches for communities along Highway 395 including Bridgeport
and Lee Vining. For Mammoth Lakes, 8 to 16 inches with up to 24
inches for the Sierra crest including Mammoth Mountain summit.
Winds could gust as high as 55 mph along Highway 395 with gusts
over 100 mph on the Sierra crest.

* WHERE...Mono County.

* WHEN...From late Wednesday night through late Thursday night.

* IMPACTS...Travel could be very difficult. Strong winds could
cause tree damage and power outages. Severe turbulence and low
visibilities could also result in aviation delays and
cancellations.
properties.instruction:
Now is the time to prepare an emergency kit for your home and
car. If traveling consider alternate plans, remember to carry
tire chains, extra food, water and clothing. Once the storm
arrives, travel may be difficult or impossible for an extended
period of time.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM LATE WEDNESDAY NIGHT THROUGH LATE THURSDAY NIGHT
